meanings.definition: Relating to or situated in the axis.
meanings.sent1: The axile plant grew straight up along the central stem.
meanings.sent2: The axile structure of the building provided stability.
meanings.sent3: The axile ruler stood tall and proud among the other measuring tools.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as axile as the backbone of a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The axile nature of the compass needle always pointed north.

meanings.sent1: The axile wheel spun smoothly around its central point.
meanings.sent2: The axile symmetry of the design made it visually appealing.
meanings.sent3: The axile toy top twirled gracefully on its axis.
meanings.sent4: His axile focus on the task at hand was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The axile rotation of the Earth creates day and night.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or resembling an axis.
meanings.sent1: The axile pattern on the fabric resembled a spinning wheel.
meanings.sent2: The axile motion of the dancer's twirl was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The axile arrangement of the books on the shelf made them easy to access.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts followed an axile path, always circling back to the main idea.
meanings.sent5: The axile structure of the DNA molecule is crucial for genetic information.
